page.title: 07FARMING 1
page.content: Farms are small by lowland standards, being anything from 50 - 100 acres. In addition to meadow and pasture most farms have sheep stints on the fell. Sheep are mostly Swaledale. Half bred lambs are produced by a Leicester cross and these, together with Swale- dale tups,wethers and surplus gimmer lambs are sold at Auction Marts at Tow Law and St.John's Chapel. Older ewes which can continue to breed for a year or two longer in a milder climate are also sold. The highest price paid for a tup sold at St.John's Chapel this year was Â£4000. The sheep are clipped in July and the wool sold to the Wool Marketing Board. On some farms large modern barns built of breeze blocks and corrugated sheeting are used for lambing, wintering stock and storing machinery.
